nodes.text: To abort because of an identified significant malformation is perfectly reasonable to me. My wife and I discussed this early in her pregnancy since we we're told that our chances of a serious genetic abnormality was 1 in 74. Long odds on a horse but seemed a real possibility at the time. We were in complete agreement to abort in the worst case scenario.
Because of course,... people with genetic malady's have no right to their lives anyway. Right?
